meanings.sent1: Yesterday, the toy car costed five dollars.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream cone costed two dollars at the fair.
meanings.sent3: The magic wand costed a fortune, but it didn't even work!
meanings.sent4: Her mistake costed her the lead in the race.
meanings.sent5: The broken vase costed more than she could afford to replace.

meanings.sent1: She carefully costed the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The contractor costed the renovation project accurately.
meanings.sent3: He costed the party decorations, but forgot to include balloons!
meanings.sent4: She costed the time it would take to finish the puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The team costed the materials for the science experiment before starting.

meanings.sent1: The cashier costed the items in the shopping cart quickly.
meanings.sent2: He costed the total expenses for the month in his budget.
meanings.sent3: She costed the vacation package and was surprised by the total.
meanings.sent4: The engineer costed the construction project down to the last nail.
meanings.sent5: They costed the event tickets before deciding to attend.
